    • Method Detail

      • getInstrumentsAllocation

        java.util.List<AtelierInstrumentsService.PersonInstrumentRow> getInstrumentsAllocation(Action action)
                                                                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Retrieve instruments allocation, for a workshop action. The allocation is a list of pair (person, instrument) called rows. The implementation should make sure it returns a row for each participant of the workshop.
        Parameters:
        action - the action of the workshop
        Returns:
        the allocation of instrument played by participant
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setInstrumentsAllocation

        void setInstrumentsAllocation(Action action,
                            java.util.List<AtelierInstrumentsService.PersonInstrumentRow> rows)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the instrument allocation, for a workshop action. The allocation is a list of pair (person, instrument) called rows.
        Parameters:
        action - the action of the workshop
        rows - the rows to modify
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getAvailableInstruments

        java.util.List<Instrument> getAvailableInstruments(Person person)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Retrieve available instruments for a given person.
        Parameters:
        person -
        Returns:
        list of instrument played by this person
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.Exception

      • getAllocatedInstrument

        Instrument getAllocatedInstrument(Action action,
                                Person person)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets the allocated instrument for a given workshop action or person.
        Parameters:
        action -
        person -
        Returns:
        the instrument speficically allocated for this action, otherwise the first instrument of the person, or null if no specific Instrument is defined.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
